data.title: Tracy favorite
data.text: I have been coming here for years.  All their food is good, and the staff if friendly and fast.  Good atmosphere for families, too.

data.title: Very fresh and moist.
data.text: Went a month ago and was so surprised at how fresh the rice and beans were. the pork and beef were so tender. Finally came back yesterday and wanted to see if it was just luck last time. Well it was exactly the same quality. And both times the food came so quickly we thought it can't be fresh. You have to try the restaurant. It is also very clean.

data.title: Get a Combo Plate And a Michelada, And Enjoy Your Food Coma
data.text:
Good service, good food and gigaantic portions.  Seriously, they're massive.  If you order one of their big combination plates, which come with with two items, chile relleno and rice and beans, then you'd better be prepared to take some of that bad boy home with you for the next day or you're headed for the 300 pound mark.

Oh, and they'll make you a nice michelada with the beer of your choice, which is the feature that pushed my review up to five stars.

data.title: Long live La Villa!
data.text: The place is clean, and always good service. Tasty food, I like the chicken fajitas and tacos.  Very good salsa and chips.  The parking could be improved.

data.title: Yummy Tamales
data.text: Great chimi's, tamales and chips and salsa. You can't go wrong with La Villa. Prompt friendly service is a plus!

data.title: La Villa Mexican Restaurant on 11-th Streer Tracy,CA
data.text: We went in January 2016 for the first time,after we saw when we driving how busy is all the time so,we thinking must be good and  we need to try it in one day.True !is a good restaurant.Small but cozy and the food is delicious.I recommended to everyone.

data.title: Best Mexican Food
data.text: My husband and I go to La Villa Mexican restaurant at least one and week if not more. The food is fresh and good.  The wait staff is very friendly.  Great service.  Most of the time we never have to wait for a table.  Their salsa is excellent.

data.title: Staple Mexican
data.text: This is a staple restaurant for date night.  Always great service.  The decor is fairly old and not very comfortable, but the food is very good. Love the burrito and enchiladas.

data.title: Great place
data.text: This place is a staple in Tracy. It's been around a long time and is still here for a reason. I love anything with their pork. The salsa is awesome. The service is great. I think this place is one of the top restaurants in Tracy (though tracy doesn't offer much).

data.title: Nice place, good food
data.text: I went there for a quick lunch and ended up having the grilled taco salad and it was amazing.  I now recommend this place to all my friends.

data.title: Comfort food
data.text: They have authentic Mexican food that is always good. Their gravy is amazing!  My favorite is their super burrito or quesadilla.

data.title: Good, consistent Mexican Food
data.text: This restaurant has always been a favorite of ours.  Just good, consistent food.  Love the chips and salsa.  They offer reasonable lunch plates that appeal to everyone.

data.title: Okay
data.text: salsa and chips good. Enchiladas are good. Food good as well but overpriced everything cost extra. Hot inside and tables were dirty.

data.title: Best in Tracy
data.text: If visiting Tracy or just traveling through in my opinion (and several other residents of Tracy), the best Mexican food Restaurant is La Villa located on 11th Street one block east of Central/Holly ave. the restaurant is small but the food won't disappoint. Authentic Mexican dishes are served and plentiful. They also have Mexican beer if one desires. Excellent food at a very reasonable price.

data.title: Mexican comfort food
data.text: La Villa is a Tracy classic. Delicious, down home Mexican cooking. The restaurant is a bit small and can be crowded, but we think that's part of its charm.

data.title: Excellent Meal
data.text: We stopped in at La Villa Mexican Restaurant while in town on a business trip.  I ordered the grilled chicken taco salad.  Our meals were delivered in a timely fashion.  The salad was huge! Against my better judgement, I finished it all and did not need another meal the rest of the day!  A bit pricey for what I would expect from a Mexican restaurant but I would definitely recommend it and eat here again.  The staff was very friendly as well.

data.title: Employees seem mad ALL the time
data.text: The food is okay and it is close which makes it an option on the night you don't want to cook.  They are the ONLY Mexican restaurant I have ever been to that will charge you for a shot glass size of mild salsa (basically tomatoe paste). Ridiculous considering the ever growing prices of their meals. The food is average but the servers always seem apathetic or pissed.  You must always ask for your refill of drink or chip's.  Our entire group commented that the employees act as though you're putting them put by asking them to do their job.  I will no longer return. Olé Mexican restaurant on La Cholla and Orange Grove has better food and by far better service.  No, I don't work at Olé or know anyone who does.....i just actually like good customer service.

data.title: Simple okay.
data.text: La Villa was my favorite Mexican place for many years. The inside is very plain vanilla. Nothing to get excited about. The service here has always been very poor and remains that way. You don't go here thinking you are going to get good service, it just isn't happening. The food here is very average, not authentic Mexican that's for sure. I had Fajitas and they were just fine but nothing I would go back for. The rice and beans were pretty much bland. They just didn't have any flavor at all. The other problem with this Restaurant is they just keep raising and raising their prices and they are to the point that there prices are that of a real good quality Mexican Restaurant, and La Villa doesn't have the atmosphere or the quality of food to charge that kind of money. In short, average is the word, and I simply won't go back as the quality of the food for the price charged is way off!

data.title: Can't bet the price
data.text: Great food, fast service, very reasonably priced and great family atmosphere! Always busy, so they must be doing something right.

data.title: Took My Husband to Lunch
data.text: I called my husband to see if he could duck out of the office for lunch. We decided on Mexican food and came here around 12:30pm. The THS cheerleader's were obviously at lunch as well. However, we were served quickly and received our meal promptly. My husband had the enchilada's which he really liked and will be eating leftovers today for lunch. I had the flauta's (chicken) and they were delish. The guacamole was a bit heavy on the lime so I didn't care for it. We really enjoyed their menu and food. Down side is the after effects of "Old oil." Please change your fry oil more often. Second time I have eaten at a Mexican Restaurant and this was the case. I will give it one more try and if it happens again. Well, I won't be back. A bit pricey for lunch. Two of us with a diet coke and lemonade came to $35
